name: 李老师不是你老师
content:
On April 21, Shanwei, Guangdong
Due to dissatisfaction with the reduction of unit price and treatment, Meituan deliverymen in Shanwei, Guangdong, went on strike collectively. That night, Meituan urgently dispatched deliverymen from other places with high unit price + exemption from overtime.
It is said that the treatment of deliverymen drawn from other places has exceeded the requirements of local deliverymen, causing dissatisfaction among the deliverymen. They believe that Meituan would rather spend more money to dispatch people from other places than to restore the unit price and subsidies originally belonging to local deliverymen.
Local netizens said that the feeling on the street now is that many Meituan riders are delivering food with license plates from other places. Because they have just arrived in a new environment, there are many riders looking around to check the navigation.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content:
A Douyin anchor discovered while visiting this year's Shanghai Auto Show that some car companies had deployed security guards holding black cloth and black umbrellas in advance to prevent people from holding banners to defend their rights.
In another video, the use of black umbrellas and black cloth was demonstrated.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: On April 22, the Shanghai Securities News confirmed that starting from May, the salaries of civil servants, public institution staff and state-owned enterprise staff in Changshu City will be paid in full in digital RMB.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content:
Netizen contribution
On April 12, an accident occurred in the 092nd issue of Fujian Sports Lottery 31-choose-7.
During the period, the fourth winning number ball 01 was suspected to be adsorbed on the track and unable to move, and adsorbed the subsequent winning number ball 05.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content:
Then two balls blocked the winning number balls behind.
And the lottery information of the day

name: 李老师不是你老师
content:
Netizen contribution
A post on Xiaohongshu about "township civil servants" sparked discussion among netizens. In the post, the author described how he was required to serve tea, pour water and wash dishes whenever a leader came over at work.
One netizen lamented: There are thousands of soldiers and horses just to be a waiter.
